ALLOW_EXCL.description: Set this to true if you want ! to be a command prefix along with /. Recommended is true

API_HASH.description: Get API_HASH from my.telegram.org, used for telethon based modules.

API_ID.description: Get API_ID from my.telegram.org, used for telethon based modules.

AUTHORIZED_CHATS.description: Fill User ID and Chat ID of you want to authorize for use gdrive /clone command .

BL_CHATS.description: A space separated list of group id you want blacklisted.

DEL_CMDS.description: Set this to true if you want to delete command messages from users who don't have the perms to run that command.

DEV_USERS.description: ID of users who are Devs of your bot (can use /py etc.). If you are a noob and would come and bother Legend support then keep the current ID's here at they are and add yours.

ENV.description: Setting this to ANYTHING will enable environment variables. Leave it as it is

EVENT_LOGS.description: Event logs group id number for note down important bot level events, recommend to make this public. If you don't add event log group id , gban will not work

JOIN_LOGGER.description: Give a channel id number for saving bot log

No_LOAD.description: Dont load these modules cause they shit, space separation

SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI.description: something://somewhat:user@hosturl:port/databasename  # needed for any database modules # its URI and not URL as herok and similar ones only accept it as such

SUDO_USERS.description: A space separated list of user IDs who you want to assign as sudo users.

SUPPORT_CHAT.description: Your Telegram support group username where your users will go and bother you with shit But be like: MyGroupChatUsernameBlah. If this ever points to atrocious support than consider you made an enemy.

SUPPORT_USERS.description: A space separated list of user IDs who you wanna assign as support users(gban perms only).

TIGER_USERS.description: A space separated list of user IDs who you wanna assign as tiger users.

TOKEN.description: Your bot token. Get one from telegram BotFather

WHITELIST_USERS.description: A space separated list of user IDs who you want to assign as whitelisted - can't be banned with your bot.
